content:
• Monday, June 4, 2018
  • PTLA

    Portola Pharma CEO Lis to retire; shares -2%

    • Portola Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PTLA) -1.9% after-hours following news of the retirement of Bill Lis as CEO and a a board member, effective Aug. 1.
    • John Curnutte and Mardi Dier are appointed interim co-presidents in addition to their current respective positions as Executive VP for Research and Development and CFO.
    • Lis joined PTLA in 2008 as chief business officer and COO and was appointed CEO in May 2010; he previously held positions at Scios, a Johnson & Johnson company, and Millennium Pharmaceuticals.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:46 PM | 26 Comments
  • ANW

    Aegean Marine plunges 47% amid write-off of $200M receivable

    • Microcap Aegean Marine (OTC:ANW) is seeing half its market value fall away in aftermarket trading following an after-hours update on its ongoing review that says it needs to write off $200M it's owed.
    • The company had previously disclosed that its audit committee is reviewing matters relevant to its financials for the year ended Dec. 31, 2017.
    • "Based on the preliminary findings of the review, the Audit Committee believes that approximately $200 million of accounts receivable owed to the Company at December 31, 2017 will need to be written off," the company says.
    • Those amounts are due from four counterparties.
    • The transactions that led to that $200M "may have been, in full or in part, without economic substance and improperly accounted for in contravention of the Company’s normal policies and procedures," it says.
    • Shares are down 47.4% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM | 122 Comments
  • NX

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (06/04/2018)

    • Top gainers: NX +8.4%. EGY +7.8%. KNDI +7.8%. MYL +5.3%. HQY +4.6%.
    • Top Losers: ASNA -10.1%. DCPH -7.1%.  TTOO -3.8%. CALX -2.7%. AROC -2.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • NFLX

    With Monsanto deal near, Netflix to S&P 100; Twitter to S&P 500 (updated)

    • Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) is headed into the S&P 100, and Twitter (NYSE:TWTR) into the S&P 500, Standard & Poor's announces.
    • Both firms are replacing Monsanto (NYSE:MON) in the respective indexes, with Monsanto's acquisition by Bayer imminent.
    • In other moves, REGENXBIO (NASDAQ:RGNX) will move into the SmallCap 600, to replace General Cable (NYSE:BGC). General Cable is set to be acquired by Prysmian Group.
    • RGNX is up 0.7% after hours in what looks to be thin trading. Shares declined 6.8% today.
    • All moves are effective prior to Thursday's open.
    • After hours: NFLX -0.2%.
    • Updated 5:27 p.m.: Twitter shares are up 3.6% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM | 23 Comments
  • MYL

    FDA OKs Mylan's Neulasta biosimilar; shares up 5% after hours

    • Mylan N.V. (NASDAQ:MYL) is up 5% after hours on the news that the FDA has approved its biosimilar of Amgen's (NASDAQ:AMGN) Neulasta (pegfilgrastim), branded as Fulphila (pegfilgrastim-jmdb).
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 14 Comments
  • DCPH

    Deciphera readies stock offering; shares down 7% after hours

    • Deciphera Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:DCPH) is down 7% after hours in response to its preliminary prospectus for a public offering of 3.75M shares of common stock. Price and terms have yet to be released.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • CATB

    Catabasis Pharma files for $30M equity offering; shares off 7% after hours

    • Thinly traded nano cap Catabasis Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:CATB) is down 7% after hours in response to its preliminary prospectus for a $30M offering of units, each consisting of one share of common stock and one warrant to purchase one share of common. Prices, volumes and terms have yet to be determined.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 13 Comments
  • BDR

    Blonder Tongue jumps 20%; discloses end of sale-leaseback deal

    • Nanocap TV signal equipment maker Blonder Tongue Laboratories (NYSEMKT:BDR) ran itself to a 19.9% gain today on more than quadruple average volume.
    • The stock touched a new 52-week high of $2.20 before a heavy sell-off in the last 10 minutes of NYSE trading brought it to $1.63.
    • Minutes ago, the company filed an 8-K saying that on May 29 it got notice from Mountainblue Jake Brown Realty that it was terminating an agreement to buy Blonder Tongue's manufacturing facility in Old Bridge, N.J.
    • Blonder Tongue had planned to sell and lease back the facility for a five-year term. It says it will still look to sell the property, either outright or as a sale/leaseback.
    • The company manufactures signal encoding, transcoding, digital transport and broadband product solutions at the Old Bridge facility as well as through a contract manufacturer in China.
    • Shares are up another 3.1% after hours, to $1.68.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • KNDI

    Kandi Technologies plummets in late action

    • Kandi Technologies (NASDAQ:KNDI) plummeted in late day action on a move that Bloomberg reports is tied to a large block trade.
    • The block of 209K shares was unloaded at $3.85 to put downward pressure on the EV player.
    • Volume on Kandi was sky-high today with over 2.5M shares being swapped.
    • Kandi closed down 28.7% to $3.85.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 9 Comments
  • SBUX

    Starbucks' Schultz steps down as chairman

    • Howard Schultz announces his departure as executive chairman of Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) in June. He will also step down from the board after a 40-year career at the company.
    • Starbucks grew from 11 stores to over 28K under his leadership.
    • Schultz will be honored as chairman emeritus of the company.
    • SBUX -1.262% after hours to $56.35.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 144 Comments
  • AVXL

    Anavex adds to rally, up 32%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Anavex Life Sciences (NASDAQ:AVXL) was up on a solid 16x surge in volume. Shares have rallied ~90% since the company reported FQ2 results on May 10.
    • Lead candidate is Phase 2-stage ANAVEX 2-73 for Parkinson's disease dementia.
    • Previously: Anavex readies mid-stage study of lead candidate in PDD; shares ahead 2% premarket (April 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 14 Comments
  • LIVX

    LiveXLive +24.9% as Dawson James sees double-digit upside

    • Festival/event video streamer LiveXLive Media (NASDAQ:LIVX) was a top gainer among Nasdaq issues today, its second recent spike after a relatively ho-hum ride since its IPO.
    • Shares jumped May 17 from $4.225 to $6.95 on no particular reason. The company then announced a partnership with Montreux Jazz Festival later that weekend.
    • Shares closed today up 24.9% to $5.56 after an initiation by Dawson James at Buy, with a $7 price target, implying 26% upside from today's close.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • SMAR

    Smartsheet -2% despite Q1 beats, upside guidance

    • Smartsheet (NYSE:SMAR) drops 2% aftermarket on Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 63% Y/Y growth. This was the company’s first earnings report since the IPO in late April.
    • Q2 guidance has revenue from $38.5M to $39.5M (consensus: $37.23M) and EPS from -$0.14 to -$0.13 (consensus: -$0.14).   
    • Upside FY19 guidance has revenue of $159M to $162M (consensus: $155.06M) and EPS of -$0.59 to -$0.56 (consensus: -$0.61). 
    • Key metrics: Operating cash flow, -$8.2M ; FCF, -$9.7M; domain-based customers, 75,642; all customers with annualized contract values of $5K+, 4,349 (+78% Y/Y); average ACV per domain-based customer, $1.808 (+47%); total operating expenses, $42M; cash and equivalents, $49.7M. 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 4:30 PM Eastern with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release.    
    • Previously: Smartsheet beats by $0.06, beats on revenue (June 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • ASNA

    Ascena Retail lower after weak profit guidance

    • Ascena Retail Group (NASDAQ:ASNA) trades lower after reporting Q3 numbers and updating guidance.
    • The company reported a FQ3 EPS loss of $0.08.
    • Gross margin fell 190 bps to r 58.7% of sales during the quarter due partially to performance in the company's value fashion segment.
    • CEO update: "Our third quarter results reflected a soft start in February, with sequential improvement over the combined March / April period. Another strong quarter at Justice was offset by continued challenges at our Value segment, particularly at dressbarn."
    • Looking ahead, the retailer sees a FQ4 loss larger than the consensus estimate from analysts.
    • Source: Press Release
    • ASNA -1.91% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 1 Comment

  • Oil prices slide near two-month lows as OPEC seen curbing output cuts

    • Crude oil futures fell today, with U.S. WTI settling near a two-month low, as investors continue to sell in the face of growing U.S. production, possible global supply growth and nagging trade tensions.
    • July WTI settled -1.6% to 64.75/bbl, the lowest finish for a front-month contract since April 9, with August Brent -2% to $75.29/bbl, the lowest since May 8.
    • “The catalyst for this recent pullback in oil was the mention of revisions to the currently capped” production policy by Saudi Arabia and Russia, says Sevens Report co-editor Tyler Richey.
    • “If they were to increase production, then the other OPEC and non-OPEC producers would follow suit so they each maintain their market share, and once again flood the market with oil," says Andy Lipow of Lipow Oil Associates.
    • "We are breaking key levels of support now," says Phillip Streible, analyst at RJO Futures in Chicago. "Once we started taking out $65.50 or so, it really started to accelerate."
    • ETFs: USO, XLE, OIL, UWT, UCO, VDE, XOP, DWT, ERX, OIH, SCO, BNO, DBO, ERY, DIG, BGR, GUSH, DTO, FENY, USL, IYE, DUG, DRIP, IEO, FIF, DNO, NDP, PXE, OLO, RYE, PXJ, SZO, CRAK, FXN, OLEM, WTIU, DDG, OILK, NANR, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, USOD, FTXN, JHME, UBRT, ERYY, DBRT, ERGF, OILD, OILU, USAI
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 32 Comments
  • CTMX

    Investors unmoved with CytomX's data on CX-072; shares down 16%

    • CytomX Therapeutics (CTMX -16.2%) finished in the red today on more than a 4x surge in volume after it announced two ASCO presentations this morning focused on lead candidate CX-072.
    • Preliminary results from the Phase 1/2 PROCLAIM-027 assessing lead candidate CX-072 alone and in combination with Bristol-Myers Squibb's Yervoy (ipilimumab) or Roche's Zelboraf (vemurafenib) in heavily pretreated patients with advanced solid tumors, showed a 15% response rate and 55% disease control rate.
    • In the Phase 1 dose-escalation portion, the maximum tolerated dose has not been reached. Most treatment-related adverse events were mild or moderate.
    • The company will host a conference call today at 5:00 pm CT to discuss the data.
    • Previously: CytomX up 6% premarket on CX-072 data (May 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • NX

    Quanex Building Products beats by $0.01, misses on revenue

    • Quanex Building Products (NYSE:NX): Q2 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $214.21M (+2.4% Y/Y) misses by $0.6M.
    • Shares +2.71%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • COUP

    Coupa Software beats by $0.10, beats on revenue

    • Coupa Software (NASDAQ:COUP): Q1 EPS of -$0.01 beats by $0.10.
    • Revenue of $56.35M (+37.0% Y/Y) beats by $5.17M.
    • Shares +1.21%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • CFX

    Colfax -3% after BofA Merrill cuts to Underperform from Buy

    • Colfax (CFX -3%) is lower after getting a double downgrade to Underperform from Buy with a $32 price target, slashed from $46, at BofA Merrill Lynch, which expects below-average core growth with margins below the 15-percent target.
    • BAML says CFX is the most vulnerable in its portfolio to macro volatility and a strengthening U.S. dollar, particularly as it has the least North American exposure.
    • "M&A is at the core of CFX’s growth strategy but CFX’s discounted valuation limits its acquisition flexibility in the current environment of elevated acquisition multiples in the industrial space," BAML writes.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 8 Comments
  • KNX

    Trade worries hit trucking names and rails

    • There's more trade anxiety in the transportation sector today as tariff rhetoric flares up again.
    • Truckers and rails in particular are in a downswing.
    • Notable movers include Knight Transportation (KNX -6.1%), ArcBest (ARCB -3.4%), Old Dominion Freight Line (ODFL -3.4%), USA Truck (USAK -3.2%), Landstar System (LSTR -3.1%), YRC Worldwide (YRCW -3.6%), Union Pacific (UNP -2.8%), Norfolk Southern (NSC -2.3%) , Kansas City Southern (KSU -1.7%) and FreightCar America (RAIL -2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 5 Comments
  • FPRX

    Five Prime pivots on bemarituzumab to first-line setting; shares down 9%

    • Investors appear disappointed with Five Price Therapeutics' (FPRX -9.1%) decision to pursue approval for FGFR tyrosine kinase inhibitor bemarituzumab in a first-line setting versus late-line use.
    • The Phase 3 portion of a Phase 1/3 clinical trial, FIGHT, assessing bemarituzumab plus mFOLFOX6 chemo compared to placebo plus mFOLFOX6 in patients with gastric cancer (GC) or gastroesophageal junction cancer (GEJ) whose tumors overexpress FGFR2b should launch in H2. The primary endpoint will be overall survival (OS).
    • Phase 1 results in 21 GC/GEJ patients with high FGFR2b expression treated with bemarituzumab alone showed a overall response rate (ORR) of 19.0%, including four confirmed partial responders, and a disease control rate of 54.9%. Median duration of response was 15.4 weeks.
    • The company says first-line chemo prolongs survival by about six months compared to best supportive care, but median OS remains poor at 10-11 months and progression-free survival (PFS) at 5.0-5.6 months. Patients with FGFR2b overexpression, representing ~10% of GC/GEJ cases, have poor prognoses.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 5 Comments
  • SSNNF

    Samsung admits to visit from Chinese regulators

    • Samsung (OTC:SSNNF, OTC:SSNLF) is the latest company to confirm that its sales offices received a visit from China’s State Administration for Market Regulation last week.  
    • A Samsung spokesman tells Reuters the company is cooperating with authorities but didn’t provide more details about the visit.
    • The visit to Samsung and SK Hynix was reported by the Wall Street Journal earlier today while Micron announced its visit last Friday. 
    • Samsung, SK Hynix, and Micron are the largest DRAM suppliers and DRAM prices are high. Analysts think China is trying to protect its smartphone and PC markets from rising DRAM costs as those products have tighter margins than in other countries.  
    • Previously: China launches foreign chipmaker probe (June 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 3 Comments
  • VNOM

    Viper Energy Partners -6% following Stifel downgrade

    • Viper Energy Partners (VNOM -5.8%) plunges after Stifel downgrades shares to Hold from Buy with a $32 price target, trimmed from $33, believing VNOM should create significant long-term value but seeing uncertainty for the next 12 months with widening basis differentials potentially weighing on units.
    • Stifel continues to expect distributions to trend modestly higher through 2018 followed by a modest decline in H1 2019 before growth resumes into H2.
    • The firm also notes VNOM short interest is trending higher with units offering a mostly pure play vehicle for investors with a bearish view on Permian basis or near-term growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 11 Comments
  • OBE

    Obsidian Energy to spend additional $50M for Cardium development

    • Obsidian Energy (OBE -3.6%) is lower after saying it plans to raise its FY 2018 capital budget by $50M to fund 13 more wells in its Willesden Green property in Alberta during H2, after production from its Cardium drilling program in the play exceeded expectations.
    • OBE expects to add ~2,300 boe/day in FY 2019 from the new wells, with monthly production reaching 3,500 boe/early next year.
    • OBE says the incremental wells will be brought on production with an estimated two-month capital efficiency of $20K/boe per day, averaging more than 80% rate of return at strip prices.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 30 Comments
  • BDR

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 PM (06/04/2018)

    • Gainers: BDR +27%. SOGO +13%. PS +8%. GIGM +8%. ZUO +8%.
    • Losers: DQ -21%. ASYS -19%. CSIQ -14%. RFIL -13%. OTCPK:LFIN -11%.
      •    
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • CPE

    Callon Petroleum not affected by El Paso force majeure event, RBC says

    • Callon Petroleum (CPE -7.3%) plunges in reaction to a force majeure event on the El Paso gas system in the Permian, which prompted a note from RBC Capital analyst Brad Heffern suggesting that CPE likely would be affected.
    • But the analyst reportedly has since said CPE does not ship any volumes on the affected line and that its volumes on the rest of the El Paso system were not affected.
    • RBC reiterates an Outperform rating and $16 price target on CPE shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • WYNN

    Wynn Resorts lower after Deutsche Bank caution

    • Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN) is down 5.94% after Deutsche Bank cuts estimates on the casino stock.
    • The investment firm warns that the World Cup soccer tournament will be a major drag on casino traffic and sees more spillover from the weak VIP revenue print from Macau for May.
    • DB is still bullish on Wynn for the long term.
    • Previously: Macau names lower after May revenue update (June 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 26 Comments
  • SC

    Santander Consumer USA +3% as analyst values Chrysler Capital at $1.2B

    • Santander Consumer US (NYSE:SC) +3% after Susquehanna analyst Jack Micenko says in a note that the financial firm's Chrysler Capital unit is valued at about $1.2B, assuming a 6x earnings multiple.
    • SC's "scarcity value" may be worth even more, Bloomberg reports, citing Micenko's note to investors.
    • Fiat Chrysler (NYSE:FCAU) announced on June 1 that it would form a U.S. finance arm and would consider buying Chrysler Capital from SC. That would be the best fit for FCAU to retain flow agreements as it related to future subprime loan production at the new captive, Micenko says.
    • Previously: Fiat Chrysler to bring U.S. financial services in-house (June 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • FIT

    Fitbit Versa ships one millionth device in seven weeks

    • Fitbit (FIT +3.4%) has hit a milestone with its Versa device, having shipped more than 1M since the April 16 general availability.
    • That makes it the fastest selling product in Fitbit's history.
    • Meanwhile, a female health tracking feature that the company added last month picked up more than a million users in its first two weeks, and more than 2.4M have started using it within a month as it added Android support.
    • The company adds that it stills sees growth in apps and clock faces made for its Fitbit OS -- more than 900 have been built from a community that includes more than 18,000 developers.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 40 Comments
  • CVE

    Reuters: ConocoPhillips preparing to sell stake in Cenovus Energy

    • Cenovus Energy (CVE -7.4%) sinks following a Reuters report that ConocoPhillips (COP -0.5%) is preparing to dispose of its ~C$2.7B stake in the company.
    • COP has held talks with investment banks about appointing advisors to the sale and could offer the shares to institutional investors as early as this month, according to the report.
    • If COP does not complete the sale in June or early July, it then would likely wait until September when institutional investors will have returned from their summer vacations, the report says.
    • CVE last year acquired oil sands and natural gas assets from COP for C$14.1B in cash and 208M CVE shares, making COP the company's largest shareholder.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 111 Comments
  • VIA

    Viacom veteran Zarghami leaving helm of Nickelodeon

    • A transition's under way at Nickelodeon, Viacom (VIA +2%, VIAB +0.6%) says, with president Cyma Zarghami exiting her post after spending more than 30 years at the network.
    • Sarah Levy, COO of Viacom Media Networks, will take over Nick while the company conducts a search to find a new president.
    • The interim team will focus on launching Nickelodeon's biggest-ever content pipeline, with more than 800 new episodes on the way.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • GHDX

    Study confirms value proposition of Genomic Health's Oncotype DX; shares up 18%

    • Data from the TAILORx study, assessing the ability of Genomic Health's (GHDX +18.3%) Oncotype DX Breast Recurrence Score test to predict which breast cancer patients could be treated with endocrine therapy alone, confirmed its value in guiding physicians to the most appropriate therapy for these patients. The results were presented as ASCO and will be published today in The New England Journal of Medicine. 
    • Oncotype DX scores of 0-25 identified 70% of early-stage breast cancer patients with HR+/HER2-, node-negative breast cancer who would receive no benefit from chemotherapy and could be effectively treated with endocrine therapy alone. Conversely, it identified the 30% who could benefit from chemo via scores of 26-100.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • GLNG

    Golar LNG +4% as Hilli Episeyo starts full commercial operation

    • Golar LNG (GLNG +3.9%) and Golar LNG Partners (GMLP +5.4%) are higher after announcing the start of commercial operations at the Hilli Episeyo floating LNG plant offshore Cameroon, marking completion of the first-ever conversion of an LNG carrier into a production facility.
    • Golar says the Hilli Episeyo generated 7.5K cm/day of LNG during a 16-day test period and likely will add $164M in yearly EBITDA as well as $45M in additional operating cash flow for the company, based on its commercial tolling rate.
    • The launch of commercial operations also allows Golar to draw on a $960M lease financing facility that will replace the existing loan package.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 11 Comments
  • SID

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (06/04/2018)

    • Gainers: SID +14%. CHNR +11%. OCIP +10%. PBR-A +9%. NXE +7%.
    • Losers: ENSV -10%. REN -10%. SM -9%. EPE -9%. HPR -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • MRSN

    Investors underwhelmed with Mersana's early-stage data on lead candidate XMT-1522; shares down 18%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Mersana Therapeutics (MRSN -17.7%) slumps on modestly higher volume in apparent reaction to its announcement of updated data from a Phase 1 clinical trial evaluating lead antibody-drug conjugate (ADC) XMT-1522 in HER2-positive breast, non-small lung and gastric cancers. The results were presented at ASCO in Chicago.
    • Dose-limiting toxicity assessments have been completed across six dose levels (seventh is in process) but the maximum tolerated dose has not been reached. Advancement into Phase 2 development is on hold until the recommended dose is determined.
    • Of the 13 patients receiving 16 mg/m2 or greater, one experienced a partial response while 11 had stable cancer, implying a disease control rate of 75%.
    • The company will host a conference call and webcast today at 6:30 pm CT to review the data.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • OCIP

    OCI offers to buy remaining OCI Partners units for $11/unit

    • OCI Partners (OCIP +9.5%) says general partner owned OCI N.V. launched an unsolicited tender offer to acquire all remaining common units representing limited partner interests in OCIP for $11/unit in cash, a 10% premium over OCIP's closing price on June 1.
    • OCI already owns 88.25% of OCIP's issued and outstanding common units.
    • OCIP owns and operates an integrated methanol and ammonia production facility on the Texas Gulf Coast with a methanol production design capacity of 912.5K metric tons/year and an ammonia production design capacity of 331K metric tons/year.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • APEN

    Apollo Endosurgery down 8% on uptick in malfunction rate of intragastric balloon

    • Thinly traded micro cap Apollo Endosurgery (APEN -8.1%) slips on more than double normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 43K shares, in apparent response to its announcement of labeling updates for intragastric balloon system ORBERA, used to control food intake (thereby promoting weight loss) in obese patients.
    • The new information, revised Directions for Use for doctors and patients and physician training information, also includes updated mortality and complication rates. All are comparable from a year ago except the rate of spontaneous hyperinflation, a situation where the saline-filled balloon overinflates with air or liquid requiring early removal. The rate as of March 31 was 0.07%, up 75% from 0.04% last year.
    • ReShape Lifesciences (OTC:RSLS -8.3%), maker of the ReShape gastric balloon, is down in sympathy.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM | 4 Comments
  • DLTH

    Duluth Holdings volatile ahead of earnings

    • Shares of Duluth Holdings (DLTH +3.1%) are volatile ahead of the retailer's Q1 earnings report due out tomorrow before the opening bell.
    • Things could get even more turbulent tomorrow as Bloomberg reports that short interest on Duluth now represents 57% of the stock's float.
    • Duluth reports just as consumer spending in retail appears to have picked up after a slow start to the warmer weather season.
    • Analysts expect Duluth to report a $0.05 EPS loss for the quarter off of revenie fof $101M.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM | 2 Comments
  • DCPH

    Deciphera Pharma up 33% on positive DCC-2618 data

    • Thinly traded Deciphera Pharmaceuticals (DCPH +33.2%) is up on almost an 8x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of less than 1M shares, following its announcement of positive data from a Phase 1 clinical trial assessing lead candidate DCC-2618 in patients with gastrointestinal stromal tumors (GIST). The results were presented at ASCO in Chicago.
    • When administered in a second-line setting, the overall response rate (ORR) was 24% and the disease control rate (DCR) was 79% (n=25).
    • In a third-line setting, ORR and DCR were 24% and 82%, respectively (n=29).
    • In a fourth-line or greater setting, ORR and DCR were 9% and 64%, respectively (n=91).
    • The company says the 24% ORR and 80% three-month DCR in combined second- and third-line patients (at doses at least 100 mg/day) exceed previously published registrational trial data for second-line sunitinib (7%/60%)(Pfizer's Sutent) and third-line regorafenib (4.5%/53%)(Bayer's Stivarga).
    • A Phase 3 study, INTRIGUE, in second-line GIST will launch this year. The primary endpoint will be median progression-free survival (PFS).
    • DCC-2618 inhibits certain kinase enzymes (KIT and PDDGa) that play a key role in the proliferation and survival of certain cancers, including brain cancer, GIST and systemic mastocytosis.
    • Related tickers: (PFE +0.4%)(OTCPK:BAYRY -0.5%)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • CLDC

    Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (06/04/2018)

    • Gainers: CLDC +7%. FFNW +6%. GGAL +6%. XRF +6%. SUPV +5%.
    • Losers: TCI -16%. PPDF -9%. CIFS -6%. CMFN -6%. DNJR -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • OESX

    Orion Energy Systems's up 2% post Q4 results

  • AAPL

    Apple kicks off WWDC (live updates)

    • Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) annual Worldwide Developers Conference starts today with the keynote scheduled to begin at 1 PM Eastern.
    • Watch the event live here.
    • Update:  CEO Tim Cook says there are now 20M Apple developers worldwide.
    • The App Store turns 10 next month and it now welcomes over 500M weekly visitors.
    • This week, the money that developers have earned from the App Store will top $100B dollars for the first time.  (Apple gets around 30% of the cut or 15% from developers who get users into long-term subscriptions.)
    • Update: IOS: Software Engineering SVP Craig Federighi announces iOS 12 and says that 81% of the current iOS install base is using iOS 11 right now.
    • IOS 12 will be available or every device that supports iOS 12 so older devices won’t get left in the cold.
    • In iOS 12, apps launch 40% faster, keyboard launches 50% faster, and camera launches 70% faster on older devices.
    • Update: ARKit: Apple worked with Pixar to make the new file format for AR: USDZ, which is described as “something like AR Quick Look.” The format allows for a WYSIWYG experience in AR.
    • Companies supporting the new file format include Adobe (with an appearance on the WWDC stage), Autodesk, Sketchfab, and Quixel. It also works in News and on the web.
    • New AR measurement tool called Measure introduced. The app has a camera view and tabs for measuring and using it as a level.
    • ARKit 2 gets improved facial tracking, realistic rendering, 3D object detection, and the expected shared experiences feature that lets users have the same experience on multiple iPhones.
    • Update: Photos: Search is getting improved with better photo recognition. Photos will index events by time and place. A “For You” tab will include featured photo suggestions and a Sharing section that suggests where and how to share certain pictures.
    • Update:  Siri: New feature/app Shortcuts lets any app “expose quick actions to Siri.” Users can record a custom phrase with the Add to Siri function. For example, “travel plans” could launch the Kayak app and trip reservation details. Siri Suggestions can be added to the lockscreen for things done on a daily basis, like checking traffic or ordering coffee.
    • Update:  App news: Stocks app gets a News element with curated business news stories and iPad support. Voice Memos getting a rebuild and iPad support. Apple Books gets new name, new design, and a “reading now” feature as a progress reminder.
    • Managing device use: Do Not Disturb is easier to activate and will include timers and new controls for bedtime and in the morning. IOS notifications will be grouped on the lockscreen, it will be easier to customize notifications, and Siri can suggest you turn off notifications for unused apps.
    • And the expected Screen Time app that shows how much time the user spends staring at the phone screen/certain apps, which includes a weekly activity summary. Parents can get the summary from their child’s phone and set allowances to limit time or access to certain apps.
    • Update:  FaceTime gets group chats that can support up to 32 people. This can launch the traditional way or through Messages, which will now have a FaceTime launch button.
    • Update:  WatchOS 5 includes the ability to challenge friends and improves the workout modes for Yoga and Hiking. WatchOS 5 can now detect when a workout starts and stops.  Watch gets Walkie Talkie to communicate through cellular or Wi-Fi. Webkit is coming to be able to see the content from a link. The Podcast app is also coming to the Watch.
    • Update: Apple TV 4K gets Dolby (NYSE:DLB) Atmos support. Atmos 4K content is available from Amazon and Netflix but Apple says iTunes will have the most Atmos 4K content.
    • Update:  Mac OS Mojave:  The OS gets Dark Mode that helps pictures and documents (or Xcode) stand out more. The UI goes dark, as do the browser, browser content, and the desktop. Another desktop feature: Stacks for auto-organizing cluttered desktops. Finder gets a Gallery view, the ability to edit photos, and the ability to select multiple files and do the same thing to them all like assembling the files into a PDF.
    • Screenshots in Mojave looks like the improved version on iOS. The screenshot puts an editable image in the corner of the screen.
    • Continuity Camera: Users can take a picture on an iPhone and it pops up directly on the Mac. This feature also works for scanning documents.
    • Mac apps: News, Stocks, Voice Memos, and Home (for smart home control) are coming to the Mac.
    • Update:  Mac App Store gets a redesign and some holdout apps like Microsoft’s Office 365 and Adobe’s Lightroom.
    • Privacy in Mac: Apple will offer more notifications when apps want access to the camera, microphone, mail, or messages. Mojave will add Safari changes to make it harder to track a user based on cookies or other system data. 
    • WWDC keynote has come to a close. Apple share are up 1% to $192.07. 
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 60 Comments

  • TWTR

    Variety: Twitter disbands video unit to reorganize efforts regionally

    • Twitter (TWTR +2%) has disbanded its live-video business unit and reconsolidated those functions as part of a content reorganization, Variety reports.
    • The video unit that was responsible for deals with Disney/ESPN, Major League Baseball and BuzzFeed will have its functions appear under Kay Madati, the company's global head of content partnerships, in a more regional structure rather than one based on categories.
    • Executives in five regions (U.S.; Latin America/Canada; EMEA; Japan/Korea; and Asia-Pacific) will run global content partnerships for Madati.
    • The move means Twitter's former head of global news, Peter Greenberger, is leaving, as is Todd Swidler, the former Bloomberg Media exec hired a year ago to lead Twitter's live-video group.
    • The regional focus doesn't portend a move away from video -- the company announced 30 new or expanded video deals at NewFronts -- but could show internal discord over how to proceed.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 8 Comments

  • SHPG

    Shire down 2% on prucalopride CV safety data

    • Shire plc (SHPG -2%) slips on below-average volume in response to cardiovascular  (CV) safety data on chronic ideopathic constipation (CIC) med prucalopride, a serotonin type 4 (5-HT4) receptor agonist. The results were presented at the Digestive Disease Week Annual Meeting in Washington, DC.
    • A pooled analysis of over 35K patients with chronic constipation who were new users of prucalopride or polyethylene glycol (PEG) showed no overall increase in major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE) in patients receiving prucalopride compared to PEG.
    • Alicia Gilsenan, Ph.D., Senior Director, Epidemiology, RTI Health Solutions, says,"Because prior 5-HT4 agonists have been associated with adverse cardiovascular events in the past, further evaluating the risk of MACE in patients taking prucalopride was important. Findings from this cohort study have provided us with real-world evidence from a large patient population about the cardiovascular safety profile of prucalopride compared with polyethylene glycol."
    • The company's U.S. marketing application is currently under FDA review with an action date of December 21.
    • Previously: FDA accepts Shire's marketing application for CIC med prucalopride, action date December 21 (March 5)

  • IDRA

    Idera Pharma down 11% despite encouraging tilsotolimod data in melanoma

    • Investors appear disappointed with interim data from a Phase 1/2 clinical trial, ILLUMINATE-204, assessing Idera Pharmaceuticals' (IDRA -10.7%) tilsotolimod in metastatic melanoma patients who failed to respond to PD-1 inhibitor therapy. The results were presented at ASCO in Chicago.
    • The overall response rate was 38% (n=8/21), including two complete responses, in advanced melanoma patients receiving the combination of tilsotolimod, an intratumorally administered toll-like receptor 9 agonist, and Bristol-Myers Squibb's (BMY -4.4%) Yervoy (ipilimumab) after switching from Merck's (MRK +2.2%) Keytruda (pembrolizumab). The ORR was only 13% in patients who switched to Yervoy alone. Median duration of response has not been reached. The disease control rate (responders + stable cancer) was 71% (n=15/21).
    • Enrollment of up to 60 subjects should be completed by year-end.
    • A Phase 3 study, ILLUMINATE-301, assessing tilsotolimod + ipilimumab compared to ipilimumab alone in anti-PD-1-refractory melanoma was launched last quarter.
